thread.title: Aeromexico Announces AccesRail AllianceTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Aeromexico Announces AccesRail AllianceTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Aeromexico Announces AccesRail Alliance Published on : Thursday, October 1, 2015
Aeromexico, Mexico’s global airline, recently signed a commercial agreement with transportation provider AccesRail, to offer customers more and better connectivity options through major railway and bus services in Spain, the United Kingdom and Canada. Aeromexico customers can buy tickets for these services from travel agencies and directly through our Reservations Center, our City Ticket Offices.
The railway and bus companies included in the agreement for the referenced countries include:
VIA Rail Canada with trains departing from Montreal, Toronto, and Vancouver to 13 destinations through Canada, such as Gaspe, Halifax, Jasper, Niagara Falls, Quebec, and Winnipeg, among others.
Renfe in Spain with train services from Madrid Atocha and Chamartin and connections to 31 destinations, such as Barcelona, Bilbao, Granada, Leon, Malaga, Murcia, Sevilla and Valencia, among others.
First Great Western in the United Kingdom offering train services from the London Paddington station to 11 cities across the country, such as Cotswolds, English Riviera, Exeter, Isles of Scilly, and Oxford, among others. In London, the agreement also includes National Express bus services from the Central Bus Station to 29 destinations, such as Birmingham, Cambridge, Cheltenham Spa, Nottingham, Oxford, and Southampton, among others.
This agreement if further proof of Aeromexico’s commitment to passengers as the carrier consolidates its leadership position by offering customers quality ground and rail transportation services for a unique travel experience.
Source:-Aeromexico
